serviceName: Make a lasting power of attorney
startContent:
You can make a lasting power of attorney (LPA) using our online service.

If you want to, you can ask someone else to use the service for you, for example a family member, friend or solicitor. You will still need to make all the decisions about what goes on the LPA.

We’ll save the LPA as you progress so you do not need to complete it in one go. You can sign out at any time and come back later.

It costs £82 to apply for an LPA.

Information you'll need

You may find it useful to gather some information before you start.

As well as your details, you’ll need the names, addresses and dates of birth of:

  • the attorneys
  • the replacement attorneys, if you decide to have any

You’ll also need the name and address of your certificate provider.

Documents, equipment and other things you'll need

You'll also need:

  • a debit or credit card to pay the application fee
  • a mobile phone, so we can text you a security code
  • documents or information to prove your identity
What you need to prove your identity

When you make an LPA, we need to check your identity. We do this to protect you and prevent fraud.

You can prove your identity by:

  • entering details from your passport or driving licence
  • entering details from, and uploading a photo of, a recent payslip or P60
  • signing in to your Government Gateway, Department for Work and Pensions, or online banking account, and letting us confirm your details with those organisations
  • taking documents to a Post Office
  • asking a professional (like a teacher, civil servant or solicitor) to confirm your identity
